titleStmt.title: Letter from Hilda Neihardt to Enid Neihardt, October 21, 1935
titleStmt.author: Neihardt, Hilda

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Letter from Hilda Neihardt to Enid Neihardt, October 21, 1935

msIdentifier.repository: John G. Neihardt Center Research Library, Aly Collection

div1.p: WAs so glad to get your letter. Oh, Enid, I was worried about the possible effects the Jake letter from Frankie to Betty, after I heard that F. was sort of - well, not so friendly as usual - so I told Betty not to answer. She was completely fooled, thouhg. It's too bad I told her, perhaps. Of course I don't know Hugh M. at all - having seen him only once - but if you think he's as O.K.

as he seems, I'd like very much to have him for a brother - in - law! I've had a few good times. We've had a hall dance on two or three, and they were quite enjoyable. I'm rather friendly witha rather nice young man here. We, I believe, likes me a lot; I could never be more thana friend to him. I'm give out with him several times. Saturday night Edith and I went to the dance down town. We had a very good time; in fact, we hat so much to leave that we got in 15 minute late. That's not going to be so very though. I shall probably go to the Homecoming from -

unless Betty comes home then If she does, I'll probably not go - for she won't be here long, and I'd hate to not get to see her ^except for a few minutes a maybe home. If I go, it will be nice. Perhaps I'll have a good time. I'll wear my evening gown. You don't know how hard it is for me to get other people to realize that I'm interested in anything other than studies. They out Hilda Neihardt on a sort of pedestal of scholarship & honor, am never dream that maybe she just an ordinary girl is many, most ways.

For all my sins I've a cold as chastisement. A rather bad one, two, although not so bad as Alice's. Poor kid! I surely her! I had such an enjoyable time with the Conns!! I hated to see them leave this morning - it's just like some of my our folks leaving! They asked about you - Said the political job turned out to be nothing. I have to attend two meetings this afternoon. One is of the Y.M.CA. chairmen, the other of those in charge of Homecoming program. Oh, it's cold and damp here! All the leaves are gone. Are they gone at home? Tell me, please.

Friday Night I saw "Little America", a of Admiral Bird's visit to Little America. Quite a fine and worthwhile picture. Well, old kid, write me - telling me all your troubles & joys. I was surprised - really - about Tracy. I didn't realize it was that had with him. Have to dash off to those meetings now, or I'd write more. Oh, I'm so very busy!!

closer.note: P.S. Won't let anyone get the idea that I'm running dancing into the ground - I'm not
